arm_group.description: Two TAU-284 5mg tablets will be taken orally twice a day, once after breakfast and once after dinner (or before bed).

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of TAU-284
      (Bepotastine besilate) in pediatric patients with perennial allergic rhinitis for 12 weeks
      administration.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Long-Term Study of TAU-284 in Pediatric Patients With Perennial Allergic Rhinitis

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multicenter,open-label, single-arm, uncontrolled study to evaluate the safety and
      efficacy of TAU-284 (20 mg/day) in pediatric patients with perennial allergic rhinitis for
      12 weeks administration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients aged between 7 and 15 years

          -  Patients who have received a diagnosis of perennial allergic rhinitis according to
             the diagnostic criteria

          -  Patients with a mean total score for the three major nasal symptoms [sneezing,
             rhinorrhea, and nasal congestion] of at least 3 on the basis of symptoms recorded in
             the nasal allergy diary during the observation period  etc.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with vasomotor rhinitis or eosinophilic rhinitis

          -  Patients who have concurrent nasal disease that may affect the efficacy of TAU-284

          -  Patients with a history of any of the nasal surgical procedures

          -  Patients with current or previous history of drug allergy

          -  Patients who concurrently have renal function abnormalities that may cause safety
             problems  etc.

intervention.description: Two TAU-284 5mg tablets will be taken orally twice a day

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse events and adverse drug reactions

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in total score for the three major nasal symptoms [sneezing, rhinorrhea, and nasal congestion]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, Week2, Week4, Week6, Week8, Week10, Week 12 and final evaluation point

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in individual nasal symptom scores (sneezing, rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, and impairment in daily activities)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, Week2, Week4, Week6, Week8, Week10 and Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in individual scores for local nasal findings (rhinoscopic findings)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Second enrollment, Week2, Week4, Week6, Week8, Week10 and Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in severity score for symptoms of allergic rhinitis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, Week2, Week4, Week6, Week8, Week10 and Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of activities in daily life(study, outing, sleeping)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Second enrollment, Week2, Week4, Week6, Week8, Week10 and Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient impression of nasal symptoms(sneezing, rhinorrhea, nasal congestion, nasal pruritus, eye pruritus and eye tearing)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
